answers.answer: Hi there.Microvascular ischemic white matter disease is a general description pointing out to problems with the blood vessels supplying certain areas of the brain.  Problems with blood supply to certain parts would manifest as these 'white spots' in the brain parenchyma or white matter.Problems with the blood vessels can arise from underlying disorders such as hypertension, high blood sugar (diabetes), or high blood cholesterol.  patients with autoimmune diseases such as lupus.It is best to have these conditions ruled out, since controlling these diseases would prevent further vascular problems with the brain.Regards.
